text: Hello! I have a new website!
explanation: I completely remade my website (and logo) from the ground up. I made it with Next.js, if you know what that means.
You are looking at my website so im just saying hi.
Hello, but Japanese. (I'm learning Japanese)
"Welcome to my website!" but in Spanish.

The 1987 hit song by Rick Astley with this title is a meme. It is used to trick people into clicking on a link that leads to a Rick Astley music video. I am not going to do that to you. I promise. (Or will I...?)
Placeholder text because i think it is funny.
This is a comment, or a non-executable line of code, used as a note for the developer. This is a joke referring to the fact that I am a developer and that I did not hide if from the website.

text: I'm a software developer, if you didn't know.
explanation: Self explanatory.
A quote from my friend Clari when asked for an idea for a splash text.
My website I have been working on for a while is finally here!
I don't recommend using this password. It is really easy to guess. (Copied from Minecraft's splash text)

text: Lives in a pineapple under the sea!

This is a traditional first program for learning a new programming language. It is a simple program that outputs the text "Hello, world!" to the screen.
Hello, but Spanish (I know some Spanish)
This is filler text in Latin that is commonly used to demonstrate the graphic elements of a document or visual presentation.

This is a reference from Genshin Impact. Paimon is friends with the main character and there is an ongoing joke about the main character introducing Paimon as emergency food, and this is Paimon's response.
I. AM. A. ROBOT. (Stereotypical robot noises)

This is a meme from the Japanese voice over of the game Genshin Impact where Paimon says "「えへ」て何だよう！？" (pronounced "Ehe te nandayō?!?") which translates to "What do you mean 'hehe'?" when another character says "hehe".
This is a link to the 1987 hit song by Rick Astley titled "Never Gonna Give You Up". It is used to trick people into clicking on a link that leads to a Rick Astley music video.
I was trying to say "PineappleFan Approved" but GitHub Copilot suggested this. My friend PineappleFan is a really nice person though.
My friend PineappleFan approved of my website.
This is an emoticon that is commonly used to express cuteness.
A shrug emoticon.
A table flip emoticon that is commonly used to express anger.
A happy waving emoticon.
PineappleFan suggested this as a joke... I mean, i think i'm pretty good at web development. I made this website after all.

This is a meme from the show "The Office". It refers to an image of Jim from The Office holding a sign next to Dwight's head that reads either 5 or 6 "days since our last nonsense." (Suggested by PineappleFan)
This is a typo I made a few years ago while trying to type "Discord good™️" when something on Discord didn't work as intended. It quickly became a meme with my friends.
This is a reference to Minecraft's splash text "Also try Terraria!" and Terraria's splash text "Also try Minecraft!"
This is a reference to Minecraft's splash text "Also try Terraria!", but this time referring to Genshin Impact instead of Terraria. Genshin Impact is a good game.
This is my current Adventure Rank in Genshin Impact. I have been playing the game for quite a while now. (Since April 2021) The highest Adventure Rank is 60 at the moment.
